detailed_results.input: My mother Thetis tells me that there are two ways in which I [Achilles] may meet my end. If I stay here and fight, I shall not return alive but my name will live for ever:
detailed_results.reasoning: The gold formula expresses that if Achilles stays and fights, then he will die and his name will live forever. The prediction incorrectly splits the property into two separate G formulas with a disjunction, and changes the condition and outcome: it says either always (fight and not alive) or always (runaway and name lives forever). This misrepresents the original meaning, which is a conditional guarantee about the consequences of staying and fighting, not a disjunction of two unrelated always-properties. The coalition is correct, but the temporal structure, logical connectives, and overall meaning are wrong.

detailed_results.reasoning: The gold formula <<Rover>>G !stuck_forever expresses that the rover can guarantee it is never the case that it is stuck forever (i.e., it is never permanently stuck). The prediction <<Rover>>G!stuck uses the predicate 'stuck' without the 'forever' modifier, which changes the meaning: it guarantees the rover is never stuck at any moment, rather than never stuck forever. This is a stricter property and alters the intended temporal scope (persistent avoidance vs. avoidance of permanent condition).
